data.title: The remains of Richard III, one of the most famous figures in English history, has been found.
Malala, teen champion of girls' rights, has been formally nominated for the 2013 Nobel Peace Prize
Woman in Bolivia has been building homes for the poor out of plastic bottles. These things are amazing.
Muslim patrols stalking British streets could become “a lot more dangerous” and perhaps even willing to maim or kill, the head of an anti-extremism organisation has warned
Ahmadinejad says he wants to be Iran’s first astronaut
Match fixing in European Soccer: Investigators identify 380 fixed football matches, 425 corrupt officials and players. Including Champions League matches.
Yemen confirmed on Saturday that a ship intercepted last month off its coast was an Iranian vessel trying to smuggle explosives and surface-to-air missiles to the country

Windfarms in Spain Produce More Electricity Than Any Other  Source for 1st Time - Wind energy exceeded output from both nuclear & coal-fired power stations & represents over a quarter of Spain's total power generation
North Korea 'preparing for two nuclear tests'

In her first video statement since she was nearly killed, a Pakistani schoolgirl shot by the Taliban remained defiant in arguing for girls' education, saying Monday she would keep up the same campaign that led to her attack.
